docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 22 -- Business generally was at a low ebb in the stock markets here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 22 -- Business generally was at a low ebb in the stock markets here today.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Business Is at a Low Ebb and Lack of Offerings Serves to Move Prices Up

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 25 -- A deadline of Oct. 29 was fixed today by the Palestine committee of the United Nations General Assembly for the submission of detailed proposals for the partition of Palestine and for the alternate Arab plan of a...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 25 -- A deadline of Oct. 29 was fixed today by the Palestine committee of the United Nations General Assembly for the submission of detailed proposals for the partition of Palestine and for the alternate Arab plan of a unitary state.

headline.main: OCT. 29 IS DEADLINE ON PALESTINE IDEAS; Plans for Partition or Unified Status Must Be Submitted to U.N. Sub-unit by Date

byline.original: By FRANK S. ADAMSSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 23 -- Both subcommittees of the Palestine Committee of the United Nations General Assembly began their work today, but made little headway before adjournment.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 23 -- Both subcommittees of the Palestine Committee of the United Nations General Assembly began their work today, but made little headway before adjournment.

headline.main: U.N. PALESTINE UNIT GIVES AGENCY BID; Invites Participation Without Vote -- 2d Group Complains, of Moslem Preponderance

byline.original: By FRANK S. ADAMSSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 24 -- Brick, cement and tobacco shares were marked down today in the stock markets here following Sir Stafford Cripps' statement on restrictions on building and cessation of purchases of United States tobacco. However, holders declined...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 24 -- Brick, cement and tobacco shares were marked down today in the stock markets here following Sir Stafford Cripps' statement on restrictions on building and cessation of purchases of United States tobacco. However, holders declined to sell and prices improved, tobaccos rallying well above their lowest marks.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Prices Marked Down but Rally as Holders Refuse to Sell -- Gilt-Edges Dull

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 24 -- Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt appealed today for increased freedom of the press, rather than punishment of alleged warmongers, but Andrei Y. Vishinsky, Soviet Deputy Foreign Minister, brought his attack on the American press to...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 24 -- Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt appealed today for increased freedom of the press, rather than punishment of alleged warmongers, but Andrei Y. Vishinsky, Soviet Deputy Foreign Minister, brought his attack on the American press to a climax with an assertion that the refusal of the United States to take action was "encouraging" propaganda for war.
docs.abstract: S Sarper and Deputy Min Vishinsky clash, UN Assembly, over claims against Turkey for Kars and Ardahan

headline.main: BROADER FREEDOM OF PRESS IS URGED BY MRS. ROOSEVELT; She Accuses Soviet Papers of Systematic Distortion -- Turkey Clashes With Russia BROADER FREEDOM OF PRESS IS URGED

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 25 -- The Soviet Union's "anti-warmongering" resolution lost a key parliamentary battle tonight and was headed for certain defeat Monday. By a vote of 29 to 12, the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 25 -- The Soviet Union's "anti-warmongering" resolution lost a key parliamentary battle tonight and was headed for certain defeat Monday. By a vote of 29 to 12, the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly rejected a Soviet-supported move by Venezuela to send the Soviet resolution and three milder anti-war proposals from Canada, France and Australia to a subcommittee for study and conciliation.

headline.main: SOVIET RESOLUTION ON WARMONGERING SUFFERS SETBACK; U.N. Group Refuses to Name Subcommittee to Study All Proposals on Issue VOTE IS DUE TOMORROW Action Is Taken After Briton Asks Vishinsky to Drop His Allegations Against U.S. SOVIET SET BACK ON WARMONGERING

byline.original: By A.M. ROSENTHALSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: It was a quiet week in the foreign exchanges, which produced a softer tone in the pound sterling for spot and forward positions. However, dealers were unwilling to place any significance on the setback.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a quiet week in the foreign exchanges, which produced a softer tone in the pound sterling for spot and forward positions. However, dealers were unwilling to place any significance on the setback.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 27 -- The United Nations subcommittee charged with preparing a "packaged" plan for separate Jewish and Arab states in Palestine took up today the question of boundaries.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 27 -- The United Nations subcommittee charged with preparing a "packaged" plan for separate Jewish and Arab states in Palestine took up today the question of boundaries.

headline.main: U.N. PALESTINE UNIT SCANS BOUNDARIES; U.S., Asking Closed Sessions, Says Basis of Its Decisions Must Be Kept Secret Now

byline.original: By MARSHALL E. NEWTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 28 -- Bear covering by the Cape and London brought about late today a sharp recovery from yesterday's break in all gold mining shares on the stock markets here. Prices fluctuated widely at the opening, but covering was sufficient for...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 28 -- Bear covering by the Cape and London brought about late today a sharp recovery from yesterday's break in all gold mining shares on the stock markets here. Prices fluctuated widely at the opening, but covering was sufficient for many shares to close with modest gains in the day.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Gold-Mining Issues' Recovery Is Feature of Day -- Gilt-Edge Stocks Show Gains

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 30 -- Gold and Malaya Rubbers shares stood out as active features in generally quiet trading today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 30 -- Gold and Malaya Rubbers shares stood out as active features in generally quiet trading today.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Gold, Malaya Rubbers Shares Are Most Active Groups in Generally Quiet Trading
